Key Match Events: Cole Palmer scored a penalty in the 60th minute to give England the lead
Jarrad Branthwaite and Adam Wharton made their international debuts
Trent Alexander-Arnold scored England's second goal with a delightful swerving volley across the goalkeeper
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate hoped for a summer of success with England
The England manager had to cut down his 33-man squad to 26 this weekend
Players like Jarrod Bowen, Cole Palmer, Eberechi Eze, and Trent Alexander-Arnold were named in the starting XI
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate was satisfied with the performance, saying it was a good workout and a good performance
He praised the displays from Eberechi Eze and Cole Palmer
The manager was pleased that no new problems arose during the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The St James' Park crowd was a near-sellout of 50,061, and the off-field spectacle was excellent
Kieran Trippier, the Newcastle captain, was cheered enthusiastically throughout
Jordan Pickford received a mixed reception due to his Sunderland connections
Others: England's full-back situation remains uncertain, with three players used at left-back and none of them being actual left-backs
Luke Shaw is facing a race against time to be fit for the start of the tournament
Gareth Southgate has alternatives at left-back but none of them are left-footed and none of them are ideal
